summary: Lima is mentioned in the documents primarily as a location where CIA stations received classified messages and where an attack occurred on a Cuban Embassy attache's house. One classified message from December 2, 1963, was sent to CIA stations in Mexico City, Bogota, Lima, and Guatemala regarding GRACE HOLMES and a P.O. box in Coral Gables, Florida. Another document from March 3, 1977, discusses an attack on a Cuban Embassy attache's house in Lima, Peru, and references coordination of United Revolutionary Organizations. The American Embassy did not submit a report on the attack.
significance: Lima's significance in the JFK context is limited based on these documents. It appears as a location where CIA communications related to Grace Holmes were directed and as the site of an attack on a Cuban Embassy attache's house, potentially linked to anti-Castro activities. The connection to Grace Holmes, mentioned in the context of a classified message, may warrant further investigation to determine if it has any relevance to the JFK assassination.
